title: "Linkage 'Z' contains negative distances" - although no negatives, no nulls in values
body:
Thanx, for the exellcent shap -package.This might not be shap error. It well might be scipy error. I have been able to work with clustering a couple of times. I have tried it with Fix #1399 and add multi-bar plot support -version.

```
print(shap.__version__)
print(xgboost.__version__)
print(sys.platform)
print(platform.version())
print(sys.version_info)
print()

X.replace([np.inf, -np.inf], np.nan)
print('X isnull ', X.isnull().values.any())
print('X positive ', X[(X < 0).all(1)].empty)
y.replace([np.inf, -np.inf], np.nan)
print('y isnull ',y.isnull().values.any())
print('y positive ',y[y < 0].empty)

params = {
        'objective':'binary:hinge',
        'booster' : 'gbtree',
        'eval_metric' : 'error'
        }
dtrain = xgboost.DMatrix(X, label=y)
model = xgboost.train(
        params,
        dtrain,
        )   

explainer = shap.TreeExplainer(model, X)
shap_values = explainer(X)
clustering = shap.utils.hclust(X, y)
shap.plots.bar(shap_values, clustering=clustering, max_display=columns)

0.36.0
1.2.0
win32
10.0.19041
sys.version_info(major=3, minor=8, micro=5, releaselevel='final', serial=0)

X isnull  False
X positive  True
y isnull  False
y positive  True
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
ValueError                                Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-47-cc62f45f81d4> in <module>
     27 shap_values = explainer(X)
     28 clustering = shap.utils.hclust(X, y)
---> 29 shap.plots.bar(shap_values, clustering=clustering, max_display=columns)

~\Anaconda3\envs\gpa\lib\site-packages\shap\plots\_bar.py in bar(shap_values, max_display, order, clustering, cluster_threshold, merge_cohorts, show)
    121 
    122             # now relax the requirement to match the parition tree ordering for connections above cluster_threshold
--> 123             dist = scipy.spatial.distance.squareform(scipy.cluster.hierarchy.cophenet(partition_tree))
    124             feature_order = get_sort_order(dist, clust_order, cluster_threshold, feature_order)
    125 

~\Anaconda3\envs\gpa\lib\site-packages\scipy\cluster\hierarchy.py in cophenet(Z, Y)
   1670     """
   1671     Z = np.asarray(Z, order='c')
-> 1672     is_valid_linkage(Z, throw=True, name='Z')
   1673     Zs = Z.shape
   1674     n = Zs[0] + 1

~\Anaconda3\envs\gpa\lib\site-packages\scipy\cluster\hierarchy.py in is_valid_linkage(Z, warning, throw, name)
   2266                                  name_str)
   2267             if (Z[:, 2] < 0).any():
-> 2268                 raise ValueError('Linkage %scontains negative distances.' %
   2269                                  name_str)
   2270             if (Z[:, 3] < 0).any():

ValueError: Linkage 'Z' contains negative distances.
```
